metadata.title: CVE-2022-4842 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw NULL Pointer Dereference in the Linux kernel NTFS3 driver functionattr_punch_hole() was found. A local user could use this flaw to crash thesystem.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-70-generic - 5.15.0-70.77~20.04.1
